official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for repealing the gas tax and establishing a
			 carbon tax on highway fuels, and for other purposes.

text.#text: There is hereby imposed a tax at the rate specified in subsection (b) on—
methanol, ethanol, and biodiesel produced in the United States by the producer thereof, and

methanol, ethanol, and biodiesel, and any blended product thereof, entered into the United States
			 for consumption, use, or warehousing.

continuation-text.#text:

			 life-cycle emissions of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases shall be

text.#text: The rate of the tax imposed by this section is—
$50 per metric ton (or portion thereof) of total life-cycle emissions of carbon dioxide, and

an equivalent amount per metric ton (or portion thereof) of total life-cycle emissions of any other
			 greenhouse gas determined on a ratio of the amount such other greenhouse
			 gas per metric ton as the amount of carbon dioxide per metric ton,

The tax imposed by subsection (a)(1) shall be paid by the producer of the product on which such tax
			 is imposed.

The tax imposed by subsection (a)(2) shall be paid by the person entering the product for
			 consumption, use, or warehousing.
